item.name: FMS admin api config
item.description: This is a user parameter in the zabbix agent config file. It will get info using https://localhost:16000/fmi/admin/internal/v1/server/config. This will work with FMS 17 (until the trial version ends on 9/27/19) and with FMS 18.

trigger.name: FMS config change
trigger.description: fires if any part of the FMS config has changed

item.name: FMS config Authentication
item.description: Example value: "FM and External accounts (AD/OD/Local/OAuth)"

item.name: FMS config Backup Path Progressive Default
FMS config Client Stats Log Enabled
FMS config db path additional 2 RC
FMS config db path additional 2 RC Backed Up
FMS config db path additional 2 used
item.description: This one is the "secure" folder and will always be marked as "used"

item.name: FMS config db path additional RC
FMS config db path additional 2 RC Used
FMS config db path additional RC Backed Up
FMS config db path additional RC Used
FMS config db path additional used
FMS config Email Notifications Address Reply
FMS config Email Notifications Address Sender
FMS config Number of PSoS Sessions
FMS config Time Zone
item.description: Use "numeric (float)" type since "numeric (unsigned)" can't handle negative integers.

item.name: FMS config Top Call Stats Log Enabled

trigger.name: FMS process not running - Script Engine
FMS process not running - WPE
FMS process not running - fmserver
FMS process not running - Data API

item.name: System - # of Processes
item.description: This item is originally from the "Template OS Windows" template where it was named "Number of processes".

trigger.name: Too many processes on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: All FMS Processes
item.description:
Will return all processes run by user 'fmserver' and their state. 11/20/19: Added 'fmsase' user per kwalex's suggestion.
Z = zombie or dead process This item will be used for dependent items to parse and figure out if the targeted process is in it.

item.name: FMS fmsadmin -v
item.description: runs as sh, not bash like the macOS terminal so fmsadmin is not recognized automatically, need to specify the full path to where fmsadmin is

item.name: FMS fmsadmin get cwpconfig
item.description: runs as sh, not bash like the macOS terminal so fmsadmin is not recognized automatically

item.name: FMS fmsadmin get serverconfig
item.description: runs as sh, not bash like the macOS terminal so fmsadmin is not recognized automatically

item.name: FMS fmsadmin list clients
item.description: runs as sh, not bash like the macOS terminal so fmsadmin is not recognized automatically

item.name: FMS fmsadmin list files
item.description: runs as sh, not bash like the macOS terminal so fmsadmin is not recognized automatically

item.name: Log - Event
item.description:
Note: {$FMS_PATH} is a template macro which needs to be overwritten at the host level if FMS install path is not the default C:\Program Files\FileMaker Server\.
See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Database Server process has terminated abnormally
trigger.description: • True if "Error 701" and "Database Server" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Event ID 701 is an error with this message: %1 process has terminated abnormally. • For example, %1 could be "Database Server". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Database was not closed properly
trigger.description: • True if "Warning 194" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Example: Warning 194 <<HOSTNAME>> Database "<<DBNAME>>" was not closed properly; performing consistency check on <<COUNT>> blocks • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Event log error
trigger.description: • True if an error was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Event log warning
trigger.description: • True if a warning was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: FileMaker Script Engine (FMSE) process has terminated abnormally
trigger.description: • True if "Error 760" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Event ID 760 is an error with this message: FileMaker Script Engine (FMSE) process has terminated abnormally (%1), perhaps due to a plug-in or script issue. After addressing any issues, use the command "fmsadmin start fmse" to start the FMSE process. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: FMS process {{ITEM.VALUE}.regsub("^.*\t([a-zA-Z ]*) process .*$", "\1")} has terminated abnormally
trigger.description: • True if "Error 701" was observed but "Database Server" was not observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. (We already have another trigger specifically for "Database Server".) • Event ID 701 is an error with this message: %1 process has terminated abnormally. • For example, %1 could be "Database Server". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592 • To see the regex used in this trigger's name and tag in action, go to https://regex101.com/r/GaZkkM/1

trigger.name: Possible consistency check issue
trigger.description:
• True if one of the following event IDs was observed in Events.log within the last 15 minutes: 194|634|635|640|641|664|694|719. • Here are the details for these event IDs: - 194 Warning Database "%1" was not closed properly; performing consistency check on %2 blocks... - 634 Warning Database "%1" consistency check skipped by administrator, database opened. Use of this database could result in data corruption. - 635 Informational Database "%1" consistency check and open aborted by administrator, database closed. - 640 Error Schedule "%1" consistency check failed on backup of database "%2". (%3) - 641 Error Schedule "%1" unable to open backup of database "%2" for consistency check. (%3) - 664 Error Schedule "%1" completed, but consistency check failed on backups of one or more databases. - 694 Informational Opening database "%1" with consistency check... - 719 Warning Aborted consistency check on backup of database "%1". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592
The purpose of this trigger is to notify the administrator if FMS performed, or thought it needed to perform, a consistency check. In that event, the databases may need to be restored from a backup.

trigger.name: Progressive backup issue
trigger.description: • True if "Error" or "Warning" and if "progressive backup" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Note: iregexp is the case-insensitive version of the regexp trigger function. • There are several warnings that have to do with progressive backups. Since they're only warnings, the FM admin could easily miss the fact that progressive backups aren't working properly. • Example Event.log message: Warning 786 Unable to communicate with progressive backup process. Try using the 'fmsadmin restart fmsib' command to restart the process. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592 • Why last 15 minutes instead of just the last minute? We don't want to miss this if for some reason Zabbix wasn't able to collect log data in the past few minutes.

item.name: Log - Event - Errors only
item.description: See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

item.name: Log - Event - Errors & Warnings only

item.name: FMS Stats - Clients - Total (via Perfmon)
item.params: last(perf_counter[\FileMaker Server {$FMS_MAJOR_VERSION}\Custom Web Clients]) + last(perf_counter[\FileMaker Server {$FMS_MAJOR_VERSION}\ODBC/JDBC Clients]) + last(perf_counter[\FileMaker Server {$FMS_MAJOR_VERSION}\FileMaker Clients]) + last(perf_counter[\FileMaker Server {$FMS_MAJOR_VERSION}\WebDirect Clients])

Soliant FMS Screen - Disk - FMS Read/Write
Soliant FMS Screen - Memory - FMS Cache

item.name: Memory - FMS Cache Hit % - FMS Stats
item.description:
Here's a sample of what the Stats.log file looks like:
Timestamp Network KB/sec In Network KB/sec Out Disk KB/sec Read Disk KB/sec Written Cache Hit % Cache Unsaved % Pro Clients Open Databases ODBC/JDBC Clients WebDirect Clients Custom Web Clients Remote Calls/sec Remote Calls In Progress Elapsed Time/call Wait Time/call I/O Time/call Go Clients 2018-10-31 07:13:43.063 -0500 0 0 0 0 100 0 0 36 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
This item's preprocessing config uses this regular expression to extract the nth stat value: ^(?:[^\t]*\t){n}(\d+)\b « replace "n" with a number 1-17
This regex is explained here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46848494/regex-to-find-value-after-nth-occurrence-of-tab
See it in action: https://regex101.com/r/nIhhcA/1
1. Network KB/sec In 2. Network KB/sec Out 3. Disk KB/sec Read 4. Disk KB/sec Written 5. Cache Hit % 6. Cache Unsaved % 7. Pro Clients 8. Open Databases 9. ODBC/JDBC Clients 10. WebDirect Clients 11. Custom Web Clients 12. Remote Calls/sec 13. Remote Calls In Progress 14. Elapsed Time/call 15. Wait Time/call 16. I/O Time/call 17. Go Clients

item.name: FMS Stats - Remote Calls In Progress
item.description:
Here's a sample of what the Stats.log file looks like:
Timestamp Network KB/sec In Network KB/sec Out Disk KB/sec Read Disk KB/sec Written Cache Hit % Cache Unsaved % Pro Clients Open Databases ODBC/JDBC Clients WebDirect Clients Custom Web Clients Remote Calls/sec Remote Calls In Progress Elapsed Time/call Wait Time/call I/O Time/call Go Clients 2018-10-31 07:13:43.063 -0500 0 0 0 0 100 0 0 36 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
This item's preprocessing config uses this regular expression to extract the nth stat value: ^(?:[^\t]*\t){n}(\d+)\b « replace "n" with a number 1-17
This regex is explained here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46848494/regex-to-find-value-after-nth-occurrence-of-tab
See it in action: https://regex101.com/r/nIhhcA/1
1. Network KB/sec In 2. Network KB/sec Out 3. Disk KB/sec Read 4. Disk KB/sec Written 5. Cache Hit % 6. Cache Unsaved % 7. Pro Clients 8. Open Databases 9. ODBC/JDBC Clients 10. WebDirect Clients 11. Custom Web Clients 12. Remote Calls/sec 13. Remote Calls In Progress 14. Elapsed Time/call 15. Wait Time/call 16. I/O Time/call 17. Go Clients

item.name: FMS Stats - Remote Calls/sec
item.description:
Here's a sample of what the Stats.log file looks like:
Timestamp Network KB/sec In Network KB/sec Out Disk KB/sec Read Disk KB/sec Written Cache Hit % Cache Unsaved % Pro Clients Open Databases ODBC/JDBC Clients WebDirect Clients Custom Web Clients Remote Calls/sec Remote Calls In Progress Elapsed Time/call Wait Time/call I/O Time/call Go Clients 2018-10-31 07:13:43.063 -0500 0 0 0 0 100 0 0 36 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
This item's preprocessing config uses this regular expression to extract the nth stat value: ^(?:[^\t]*\t){n}(\d+)\b « replace "n" with a number 1-17
This regex is explained here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46848494/regex-to-find-value-after-nth-occurrence-of-tab
See it in action: https://regex101.com/r/nIhhcA/1
1. Network KB/sec In 2. Network KB/sec Out 3. Disk KB/sec Read 4. Disk KB/sec Written 5. Cache Hit % 6. Cache Unsaved % 7. Pro Clients 8. Open Databases 9. ODBC/JDBC Clients 10. WebDirect Clients 11. Custom Web Clients 12. Remote Calls/sec 13. Remote Calls In Progress 14. Elapsed Time/call 15. Wait Time/call 16. I/O Time/call 17. Go Clients

This item's preprocessing config uses this regular expression to extract the nth stat value: ^(?:[^\t]*\t){n}(\d+)\b « replace "n" with a number 1-17
This regex is explained here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46848494/regex-to-find-value-after-nth-occurrence-of-tab
See it in action: https://regex101.com/r/nIhhcA/1

item.name: Log - Event - Errors only
item.description: • This item must be configured as an active check. It will not work as a passive check. • The log time format doesn't need to be specified for eventlog item keys. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

item.name: Log - Event
item.description: • This item must be configured as an active check. It will not work as a passive check. • The log time format doesn't need to be specified for eventlog item keys. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Database Server process has terminated abnormally
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was Error (logseverity=4), whose event ID was 701, and whose message contained "Database Server".
• Event ID 701 is an error with this message: %1 process has terminated abnormally. • For example, %1 could be "Database Server". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Database was not closed properly
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was Warning (logseverity=2) and whose event ID was 194.
• Example: Warning 194 <<HOSTNAME>> Database "<<DBNAME>>" was not closed properly; performing consistency check on <<COUNT>> blocks • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Event log error
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was an Error (logseverity=4).
• See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Event log warning
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was a Warning (logseverity=2).
• See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: FileMaker Script Engine (FMSE) process has terminated abnormally
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was an Error (logseverity=4) and whose event ID was 760.
• Event ID 760 is an error with this message: FileMaker Script Engine (FMSE) process has terminated abnormally (%1), perhaps due to a plug-in or script issue. After addressing any issues, use the command "fmsadmin start fmse" to start the FMSE process. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: FMS process {{ITEM.VALUE}.regsub("^.*\t([a-zA-Z ]*) process .*$", "\1")} has terminated abnormally
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was an Error (logseverity=4), whose event ID was 194, and whose message did not contain "Database Server". (We already have another trigger specifically for "Database Server".)
• Event ID 701 is an error with this message: %1 process has terminated abnormally. • For example, %1 could be "Database Server". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592 • To see the regex used in this trigger's name and tag in action, go to https://regex101.com/r/GaZkkM/1

trigger.name: Possible consistency check issue
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose event ID was one of these: 194|634|635|640|641|664|694|719.
• Here are the details for these event IDs: - 194 Warning Database "%1" was not closed properly; performing consistency check on %2 blocks... - 634 Warning Database "%1" consistency check skipped by administrator, database opened. Use of this database could result in data corruption. - 635 Informational Database "%1" consistency check and open aborted by administrator, database closed. - 640 Error Schedule "%1" consistency check failed on backup of database "%2". (%3) - 641 Error Schedule "%1" unable to open backup of database "%2" for consistency check. (%3) - 664 Error Schedule "%1" completed, but consistency check failed on backups of one or more databases. - 694 Informational Opening database "%1" with consistency check... - 719 Warning Aborted consistency check on backup of database "%1".
• See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592
The purpose of this trigger is to notify the administrator if FMS performed, or thought it needed to perform, a consistency check. In that event, the databases may need to be restored from a backup.

trigger.name: Progressive backup issue
trigger.description:
• True if a Windows Application event log entry was observed whose severity was an Error (logseverity=4) or a Warning (logseverity=2), and whose message contained "progressive backup" (case insensitive match).
• Note: iregexp is the case-insensitive version of the regexp trigger function. • There are several warnings that have to do with progressive backups. Since they're only warnings, the FM admin could easily miss the fact that progressive backups aren't working properly. • Example Event.log message: Warning 786 Unable to communicate with progressive backup process. Try using the 'fmsadmin restart fmsib' command to restart the process. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

item.name: Log - Event Ω
item.description:
Note: {$FMS_PATH} is a template macro which needs to be overwritten at the host level if FMS install path is not the default C:\Program Files\FileMaker Server\.
See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Ω Database Server process has terminated abnormally
trigger.description: • True if "Error 701" and "Database Server" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Event ID 701 is an error with this message: %1 process has terminated abnormally. • For example, %1 could be "Database Server". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Ω Database was not closed properly
trigger.description: • True if "Warning 194" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Example: Warning 194 <<HOSTNAME>> Database "<<DBNAME>>" was not closed properly; performing consistency check on <<COUNT>> blocks • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Ω Event log error
trigger.description: • True if an error was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Ω Event log warning
trigger.description: • True if a warning was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Ω FileMaker Script Engine (FMSE) process has terminated abnormally
trigger.description: • True if "Error 760" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Event ID 760 is an error with this message: FileMaker Script Engine (FMSE) process has terminated abnormally (%1), perhaps due to a plug-in or script issue. After addressing any issues, use the command "fmsadmin start fmse" to start the FMSE process. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592

trigger.name: Ω FMS process {{ITEM.VALUE}.regsub("^.*\t([a-zA-Z ]*) process .*$", "\1")} has terminated abnormally
trigger.description: • True if "Error 701" was observed but "Database Server" was not observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. (We already have another trigger specifically for "Database Server".) • Event ID 701 is an error with this message: %1 process has terminated abnormally. • For example, %1 could be "Database Server". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592 • To see the regex used in this trigger's name and tag in action, go to https://regex101.com/r/GaZkkM/1

trigger.name: Ω Possible consistency check issue
trigger.description:
• True if one of the following event IDs was observed in Events.log within the last 15 minutes: 194|634|635|640|641|664|694|719. • Here are the details for these event IDs: - 194 Warning Database "%1" was not closed properly; performing consistency check on %2 blocks... - 634 Warning Database "%1" consistency check skipped by administrator, database opened. Use of this database could result in data corruption. - 635 Informational Database "%1" consistency check and open aborted by administrator, database closed. - 640 Error Schedule "%1" consistency check failed on backup of database "%2". (%3) - 641 Error Schedule "%1" unable to open backup of database "%2" for consistency check. (%3) - 664 Error Schedule "%1" completed, but consistency check failed on backups of one or more databases. - 694 Informational Opening database "%1" with consistency check... - 719 Warning Aborted consistency check on backup of database "%1". • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592
The purpose of this trigger is to notify the administrator if FMS performed, or thought it needed to perform, a consistency check. In that event, the databases may need to be restored from a backup.

trigger.name: Ω Progressive backup issue
trigger.description: • True if "Error" or "Warning" and if "progressive backup" was observed in Events.log within the last collection interval. • Note: iregexp is the case-insensitive version of the regexp trigger function. • There are several warnings that have to do with progressive backups. Since they're only warnings, the FM admin could easily miss the fact that progressive backups aren't working properly. • Example Event.log message: Warning 786 Unable to communicate with progressive backup process. Try using the 'fmsadmin restart fmsib' command to restart the process. • See full list of Event.log messages here: https://support.filemaker.com/s/article/FileMaker-Server-Event-Log-Messages-1503692957592 • Why last 15 minutes instead of just the last minute? We don't want to miss this if for some reason Zabbix wasn't able to collect log data in the past few minutes.

item.name: FMS DMP Timestamp
item.description:
DMP files are created in the Logs folder whenever FMS has an internal exception (error).
This retrieves timestamp of most recent DMP file formatted like this: 2019-03-10 14:23:40
If there is no DMP file, the value will be blank.
Note: {$FMS_PATH} is a template macro which needs to be overwritten at the host level if FMS install path is not the default C:\Program Files\FileMaker Server\.

step.params: if (value.length < 1) return 0 var offset = Date(value).match(/([-+]\d\d:\d\d)/)[1] return Date.parse(value+offset)/1000

trigger.name: DMP file detected
trigger.description:
DMP files are created in the Logs folder whenever FMS has an internal exception (error).
We're using an item whose value is the timestamp of the most recently created DMP file. (If there are no DMP files, the timestamp value will be blank.)
